alert.note: Alert for Eastern Addison; Eastern Rutland; Orange; Western Addison; Western Rutland; Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 19 at 8:10PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A snow squall will impact portions of southern Orange, southeastern Addison, northeastern Rutland and Windsor Counties through 900 PM EST... At 810 PM EST, A snow squall was reported along a line extending from Fairlee to Leicester. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds 35 mph or greater, and visibility less than a quarter mile. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and will blow around unsecured objects. Very low visibility will pose a hazard to motorists. Locations impacted include... Woodstock, Rutland, Hartland Four Corners, Killington, Thetford Hill State Park, Bethel, Randolph, Strafford, Rochester, Pomfret, Plymouth, Thetford, Hartland, Chittenden, Goshen, Fairlee, West Fairlee, Barnard, Woodstock Village and Tunbridge. This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 between mile markers 1 and 30. Interstate 91 between mile markers 60 and 71, near mile marker 73, and between mile markers 75 and 95.
info.instruction: Rapid visibility reduction and potentially icy roads are likely to produce hazardous driving conditions. travel is not advised during this snow squall. If you are traveling and encounter adverse winter driving conditions, reduce speed and make sure headlights are on to increase the visibility of your vehicle to those around you.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Addison; Eastern Rutland; Orange; Western Addison; Western Rutland; Windsor
